title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 154.8 - Net operating loss deduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 154.8 - Net operating loss deduction

State Regulations
(a) Change of resident status from resident to nonresident. Where the Federal
income tax return of an individual or of a trust, for a taxable year in which
such individual or trust changes resident status from that of a resident to a
nonresident, includes a net operating loss deduction, the amount of net
operating loss deduction for Federal income tax purposes will be considered a
net operating loss deduction on the New York State income tax return for the
period of residence. Any excess of the amount of the net operating loss
deduction not applied on the New York State income tax return for the period of
residence may be applied on the New York State income tax return for the period
of nonresidence, but only to the extent that such excess is based solely on
items of income, gain, loss and deduction derived from or connected with New

York State sources (see section
132.7
and Part 138 of this Title). (b) Change of resident status from nonresident to resident. In computing the New

York adjusted gross income of an individual to be reported on the New York

State personal income tax return for the period of nonresidence or in computing
the New York taxable income of a trust for the period of nonresidence, any net
operating loss deduction must, as required by section
132.7
and Part 138 of this Title, be based solely on items of income, gain, loss and
deduction derived from or connected with New York State sources. For purposes
of this section, the source of the net operating loss must be determined by
reference to the source of the items of income, gain, loss and deduction for
the year or years in which the net operating loss was sustained. A net
operating loss deduction may be applied to the New York State income tax return
for the period of residence in the amount which would be allowed as a net
operating loss deduction for Federal income tax purposes, computed, in
accordance with Federal rules and practice applicable to net operating loss
deductions, as if a Federal income tax return had been filed for the period of
residence. (c) A net operating
loss, sustained in the year the change of resident status occurs, may be a
carry-back or a carry-over to another taxable year under the following
conditions: (1)

If the taxable year to which
the carry-back or carry-over is to be applied is a taxable year in which an
individual or a trust is a resident, such carry-back or carry-over may be
applied on the New York State resident income tax return to the extent such
carry-back or carry-over is includible as a carry-back or carry-over in the
computation of Federal adjusted gross income of an individual or Federal
taxable income of a trust for such taxable year, and only if the taxable year
for which the carry-back or carry-over is to be applied is a taxable year under
article 22 of the Tax Law. (2)

If
the taxable year to which the carry-back or carry-over is to be applied is a
taxable year in which an individual or a trust is a nonresident, such
carry-back or carry-over may be applied on the New York State nonresident
income tax return to the extent that such carry-back or carry-over is based
solely on items of income, gain, loss or deduction derived from or connected
with New York State sources, and only if the taxable year for which the
carry-back or carry-over is to be applied is a taxable year under article 22 of
the Tax Law. (d) For the
effect of a net operating loss deduction in arriving at New York State minimum
taxable income, see Parts 122 and 141 of this Title. Notes
